thread.title: John Fassel expected to remain with Rams as special teams coordinator
thread.title_full: John Fassel expected to remain with Rams as special teams coordinator

title: John Fassel expected to remain with Rams as special teams coordinator
text:
John Fassel expected to remain with Rams as special teams coordinator John Fassel expected to remain with Rams as special teams coordinator By Bryan Kalbrosky 7 hours ago 183 shares By: Bryan Kalbrosky | 7 hours ago 
Former Los Angeles Rams interim head coach John Fassel always wanted to be a special teams coordinator. It seems he will remain in the role. ICYMI: #Rams expected to retain special teams coach John Fassel. He served as interim HC after Jeff Fisher was fired 
— Vincent Bonsignore (@DailyNewsVinny) January 13, 2017 
Here’s what Fassel said to the media when he was about staying in that role after becoming an interim head coach on December 13: 
“I can’t say, honestly, that the last five, six, eight years as a special teams coordinator I was coordinating special teams to become the head coach. I can’t say that that was an aspiration. I wanted to be a great special teams coach, and if that’s all I did for the rest of my career, I’d be super happy doing that.” 
The Rams do have one of the most impressive special teams units in the NFL. 
Fassel is beloved by his players, including star punter Johnny Hekker — who had an interesting tweet about his coach when he heard rumors Fassel would return. If your source is wrong, you're getting kicked in the shin. https://t.co/p4Ol228uwS 
— Johnny Hekker (@JHekker) January 13, 2017 Related:
